page.title: 12BASWICH-A TYPICAL SUBURB?
page.content: The class conducted a survey as to how people get to work each day, how far they travel and how long it takes them. Statistics were taken from 202 contributors. (This does not mean 202 households,but nevertheless is 202 individual travellers). The area has no industry of its own. Only 3 people have a home-based job, everyone else must travel to work. G.E.C. is the largest employer in Stafford, but only 11.5% of our survey work there.However,G.E.C. is half-way into Stafford, and another 57.5% work in Stafford itself. If all of these people take the direct route 69% of our survey converge on Stafford by the main road each morning and leave again in the evening. (We cannot prove exactly how many use it,as some will prefer a more circuitous but less frustrating route).
